greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of values of k such that k + (sum of digits of k) is n.
comment: a(n) is the number of times n occurs in A062028.
For n>=1, a(10^n) = a(9*n-1). - _Max Alekseyev_, Feb 23 2021
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Index entries for Colombian or self numbers and related sequences
maple: for n from 0 to M do
t1:=[seq(A062028[i],i=0..M)]; # A062028 as list (but incorrect offset 1)
t2:=[seq(A230093[i],i=0..M)]; # A230093 as list, but then a(0) has index 1
# A003052 := COMPl(t1); # COMPl has issues, may be incorrect for M <> 1000
for h from 0 to ctmax do ct[h] := []; od:
for i from 1 to M do
if h <= ctmax then ct[h] := [op(ct[h]),i]; fi;
A225793 := ct[1]; A230094 := ct[2]; # A003052 := ct[0]; # see there for better code
program: (Haskell) a230093 n = length $ filter ((== n) . a062028) [n - 9 * a055642 n .. n]  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 11 2013
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 10 2013
